class="textwidget custom-html-widget"><div class="rich-text-cascade"><style>\r\n\r\n\t\r\n\t.corona-wrapper {\r\n\t\twidth: 100%;\r\n\t\ttext-align: center;\r\n\t}\r\n\t\r\n\t.corona-header-desktop class="rich-text-cascade"></div></div>\n\t\t</section>\t\t</div>\n\t\n\t\n\t<div class="site-content__layout site-content__layout--has-sidebar">\n\t\t\n\t\t\n\t\t\n\t\t<div id="primary" class="content-area">\n\t\t\t<main id="main" class="site-main">\n\n\t\t\t\t\n<article class="article post-615769 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-coronavirus category-health category-local-news category-news category-top-stories category-top-video category-video tag-coronavirus tag-covid-19 tag-governor-gina-raimondo tag-ri-coronavirus-response" data-component="article">\n\t\n<header class="article-header">\n\t<h1 class="article-title">\n\t\tRaimondo puts out call for teaching help, provides update on K-12 coronavirus testing\t</h1>\n\n\t\t\t<div class="article-eyebrow">\n\t\t\t<a href="https://www.wpri.com/health/coronavirus/">Coronavirus</a>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\n\t\n\t<div class="article-meta">\n\t\t\t\t\t<p>by: <a href="https://www.wpri.com/author/shaun-towne/" title="Posts by Shaun Towne" class="author url fn" rel="author">Shaun Towne</a></p>\n\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\tPosted: <time datetime="2020-10-07T11:13:40-04:00">Oct 7, 2020 / 11:13 AM EDT</time>\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class="article-meta--sep"> / </span>Updated: <time datetime="2020-10-08T10:02:38-04:00">Oct 8, 2020 / 10:02 AM EDT</time>\t\t\t</div><!-- .article-meta -->\n\n\t\t\t<figure class="article-featured-media">\n\t\t\t<div class="media-wrapper">\n\t\t\t\t<figure class="ns-block-embed-anvato"><div class="ns-block-embed__wrapper"><div id="p25"></div></div><script data-anvato-params class="article-lead-share">\n\t\t\n<div data-component="addThisInline" class="social-share addthis">\n\t<div class="addthis_inline_share_toolbox"></div>\n</div>\n\t</div>\n</header><!-- .article-header -->\n\n\t\n\t<div class="article-content rich-text">\n\t\t\n\t\t\n<p>PROVIDENCE, R.I. (WPRI) \xe2\x80\x94 While providing an update Wednesday on Rhode Island schools, Gov. Gina Raimondo didn&#8217;t mince words: &#8220;We need your help.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She was speaking specifically to two groups of people: retired educators and people who have considered taking up teaching.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>With students across Rhode Island learning in the classroom, at home, or some combination of the two, teachers are working harder than ever and school districts are stretched thin, according to Raimondo.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We just don&#8217;t have enough teachers for the virtual learning,&#8221; Raimondo said. &#8220;We have a lot of kids who have chosen that option and we need your help.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<aside class="promo-link">\n\t<a\n\t\thref="https://www.wpri.com/back-to-school/substitute-shortage-could-be-a-bigger-problem-in-pandemic-schooling/"\n\t\tclass="promo-link__link"\n\t>\n\t\tTarget 12: Substitute shortage could be a bigger problem in pandemic schooling\t</a>\n</aside>\n\n\n\n<p>To that end, the governor implored retired teachers to consider coming back as substitutes. And as for Rhode Islanders who don&#8217;t have a teaching degree but would like to contribute, she announced the R.I. Department of Education is offering a <a rel="noreferrer noopener" href="https://courses.highlanderinstitute.org/" target="_blank">free training course</a> through <a rel="noreferrer noopener" href="https://highlanderinstitute.org/" target="_blank">the Highlander Institute</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Apply for the training program and learn more about it <strong><a href="https://courses.highlanderinstitute.org/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">here</a></strong>.</p>\n\n\n<figure class="ns-block-embed-anvato"><div class="ns-block-embed__wrapper"><div id="p26"></div></div><script data-anvato-params type="application/json">{"mcp":"LIN","width":"100%","height":"100%","video":"5917593","autoplay":false,"expect_preroll":true,"pInstance":"p26","plugins":{"comscore":{"clientId":"6036439","c3":"wpri.com","script":"//w3.cdn.anvato.net/player/prod/v3/plugins/comscore/comscoreplugin.min.js","useDerivedMetadata":true,"mapping":{"video":{"c3":"wpri.com","ns_st_st":"wpri","ns_st_pu":"Nexstar","ns_st_ge":"Video,News,Top Video","cs_ucfr":""},"ad":{"c3":"wpri.com","ns_st_st":"wpri","ns_st_pu":"Nexstar","ns_st_ge":"Video,News,Top Video","cs_ucfr":""}}},"dfp":{"adTagUrl":"https://pubads.g.doubleclick.net/gampad/ads?sz=1x1000&iu=/5678/lin.wpri/health/coronavirus&impl=s&gdfp_req=1&env=vp&output=vmap&unviewed_position_start=1&vid=short_onecue&cmsid=1234&url=https://www.wpri.com/health/coronavirus/october-7-ri-coronavirus-update/&ciu_szs=728x90,300x250&ad_rule=1&description_url=https://www.wpri.com/health/coronavirus/october-7-ri-coronavirus-update/&cust_params=vid%3D5917593%26cmsid%3D615769%26pid%3D615769%26vidcat%3D/health/coronavirus%26bob_ck%3D[bob_ck_val]%26d_code%3D227%2C189%2C230%2C226"}},"accessKey":"m3E80nAx02K5gfOPJSgHJMr7nAk9MbDP","token":"eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJ2aWQiOiI1OTE3NTkzIiwiaXNzIjoibTNFODBuQXgwMks1Z2ZPUEpTZ0hKTXI3bkFrOU1iRFAiLCJleHAiOjE2MDI4MDA3NTJ9.QUwcjaOuoZLCLBSCCSlJy62O1DPmHVrn6aX2JekjV44","expectPrerollTimeout":8,"nxs":{"mp4Url":"https://nxsglobal.storage.googleapis.com/wpri/video/video_studio/102/20/10/07/5917593/5917593_E6F5DB529A994624AC270F54F9173CF3_201007_5917593_VIDEO_NOW__Governor_Raimondo_discusses_K_12_case_600.mp4"},"disableMutedAutoplay":false,"recommendations":false,"expectPreroll":true,"titleVisible":true,"pauseOnClick":true,"trackTimePeriod":60}</script></figure>\n\n\n<p>Raimondo on Wednesday also discussed coronavirus testing, specifically the state&#8217;s dedicated K-12 testing system. She said nearly 6,000 tests have been performed through that system so far, of which 109 came back positive.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>To date, there have been more than 260 cases in the school community, Raimondo said, meaning more than half of those people went through the state&#8217;s standard testing system. She encouraged families and educators to use the K-12 system since it offers same-day testing and results and allows the state to closely track the data.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;The partnership that we have with schools and the work that we&#8217;re doing is paying off, and people should feel confident that we have a good system,&#8221; Raimondo added.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The number to schedule a test is 844-857-1814.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Raimondo said the cases are spread throughout 95 schools in Rhode Island, and the majority of those (69) have had only one case. She also said there are more cases among those learning and teaching virtually than their in-school counterparts, but her office later confirmed to 12 News that she misspoke. (There are currently 150-154 in-person cases and 110-114 virtual cases, according to the Health Department.)</p>\n\n\n\n<figure class="wp-block-embed-twitter aligncenter wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-twitter"><div class="wp-block-embed__wrapper">\n<blockquote class="twitter-tweet tw-align-center" data-width="550" data-dnt="true"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Gov. Raimondo&#39;s office confirms she misspoke when she said at briefing just now there have been more K-12 Covid cases in virtual school than in-person school.<br><br>Dept of Health numbers:<br>150-154 cases for in-person school<br>110-114 in virtual school</p>&mdash; Steph Machado (@StephMachado) <a href="https://twitter.com/StephMachado/status/1313894626546384898?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">October 7, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script>\n</div></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Having previously criticized Warwick school officials for deciding to go fully remote to start the year, she praised the school committee for <a href="https://www.wpri.com/health/coronavirus/school-updates/warwick-school-committee-approves-gradual-return-of-grades-k-6/">voting Tuesday night to begin bringing younger students back to the classroom</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;I don&#8217;t want to do this if it&#8217;s not safe,&#8221; Raimondo said of in-person learning. &#8220;I don&#8217;t want your children in school if I can&#8217;t say with confidence it&#8217;s safe. We don&#8217;t want teachers to have to go to work in school if we can&#8217;t say with confidence that it&#8217;s safe.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n<figure class="ns-block-embed-anvato"><div class="ns-block-embed__wrapper"><div id="p27"></div></div><script data-anvato-params type="application/json">{"mcp":"LIN","width":"100%","height":"100%","video":"5917627","autoplay":false,"expect_preroll":true,"pInstance":"p27","plugins":{"comscore":{"clientId":"6036439","c3":"wpri.com","script":"//w3.cdn.anvato.net/player/prod/v3/plugins/comscore/comscoreplugin.min.js","useDerivedMetadata":true,"mapping":{"video":{"c3":"wpri.com","ns_st_st":"wpri","ns_st_pu":"Nexstar","ns_st_ge":"Video,News,Top Video","cs_ucfr":""},"ad":{"c3":"wpri.com","ns_st_st":"wpri","ns_st_pu":"Nexstar","ns_st_ge":"Video,News,Top Video","cs_ucfr":""}}},"dfp":{"adTagUrl":"https://pubads.g.doubleclick.net/gampad/ads?sz=1x1000&iu=/5678/lin.wpri/health/coronavirus&impl=s&gdfp_req=1&env=vp&output=vmap&unviewed_position_start=1&vid=short_onecue&cmsid=1234&url=https://www.wpri.com/health/coronavirus/october-7-ri-coronavirus-update/&ciu_szs=728x90,300x250&ad_rule=1&description_url=https://www.wpri.com/health/coronavirus/october-7-ri-coronavirus-update/&cust_params=vid%3D5917627%26cmsid%3D615769%26pid%3D615769%26vidcat%3D/health/coronavirus%26bob_ck%3D[bob_ck_val]%26d_code%3Dna003"}},"accessKey":"m3E80nAx02K5gfOPJSgHJMr7nAk9MbDP","token":"eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJ2aWQiOiI1OTE3NjI3IiwiaXNzIjoibTNFODBuQXgwMks1Z2ZPUEpTZ0hKTXI3bkFrOU1iRFAiLCJleHAiOjE2MDI4MDA3NTJ9.-vRyTuV2b3ZqQDViFYADCBTrBF7FKUQyvGDgdz68xN0","expectPrerollTimeout":8,"nxs":{"mp4Url":"https://nxsglobal.storage.googleapis.com/wpri/video/video_studio/102/20/10/07/5917627/5917627_E35C2A8545944680B0B4102EDDF484F9_201007_5917627_VIDEO_NOW__Dr__Alexander_Scott_discusses_Breast__600.mp4"},"disableMutedAutoplay":false,"recommendations":false,"expectPreroll":true,"titleVisible":true,"pauseOnClick":true,"trackTimePeriod":60}</script></figure>\n\n\n<p>As for coronavirus testing statewide, the R.I. Department of Health reported 145 new positive cases on Wednesday, along with one additional COVID-19-related death: a person in their 80s.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;I don&#8217;t want you to be alarmed by the fact there&#8217;s 145 cases,&#8221; Raimondo said. &#8220;Of course, you always want fewer, but when you&#8217;re performing 9,000 or 10,000 tests a day, you&#8217;re going to see 100-150 cases a day, but in a way, that&#8217;s a good thing because we&#8217;re finding the positives and isolating them.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Hospitalizations in Rhode Island jumped to 107 (from 93 on Tuesday) which includes 10 patients in the intensive care unit and five on ventilators, according to health officials.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>In addition to the 145 tests that came back positive on Tuesday, the Health Department also newly disclosed 35 more&nbsp;cases&nbsp;from previous days over the past two weeks.</p>\n\n\n\n<div class="wp-block-columns">\n<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-top">\n<p style="font-size:38px" class="has-text-align-center"><strong>COVID-19 Tracking: <a href="https://www.wpri.com/covid-19-tracking-timeline-maps/">Maps, Charts, Interactive Data \xc2\xbb</a></strong></p>\n</div>\n\n\n\n<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-center">\n<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="alignleft size-large is-resized"><a href="https://www.wpri.com/covid-19-tracking-timeline-maps/"><img loading="lazy" src="https://www.wpri.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/23/2020/07/chart-1.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-526482" width="306" height="222" srcset="https://www.wpri.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/23/2020/07/chart-1.jpg 435w, https://www.wpri.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/23/2020/07/chart-1.jpg?resize=300,218 300w, https://www.wpri.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/23/2020/07/chart-1.jpg?resize=306,222 306w" sizes="(max-width: 899px) 100vw, 306px" /></a></figure></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n\n\n\n<p>While Rhode Island&#8217;s economy is operating at about 90% of what it was pre-pandemic, the governor said she&#8217;s watching closely for a new federal stimulus package that&#8217;s being debated in Washington.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>If Congress can&#8217;t agree on a stimulus, Raimondo said widespread layoffs would likely follow and asked President Donald Trump to step up.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We need some certainty. Just tell us. Anyone in business will tell you that. Just give us some predictability,&#8221; she said. &#8220;If we don&#8217;t get a stimulus, it&#8217;s going to be awful.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<aside class="promo-link">\n\t<a\n\t\thref="https://www.wpri.com/money/stimulus-checks-after-trumps-push-for-more-aid-negotiators-look-to-end-stalemate/"\n\t\tclass="promo-link__link"\n\t>\n\t\tThe Latest: After Trump\xe2\x80\x99s push for more aid, negotiators look to end stalemate\t</a>\n</aside>\n\n\n<figure class="ns-block-embed-anvato"><div class="ns-block-embed__wrapper"><div id="p28"></div></div><script data-anvato-params type="application/json">{"mcp":"LIN","width":"100%","height":"100%","video":"5920070","autoplay":false,"expect_preroll":true,"pInstance":"p28","plugins":{"comscore":{"clientId":"6036439","c3":"wpri.com","script":"//w3.cdn.anvato.net/player/prod/v3/plugins/comscore/comscoreplugin.min.js","useDerivedMetadata":true,"mapping":{"video":{"c3":"wpri.com","ns_st_st":"wpri","ns_st_pu":"Nexstar","ns_st_ge":"Video,News,Top Video","cs_ucfr":""},"ad":{"c3":"wpri.com","ns_st_st":"wpri","ns_st_pu":"Nexstar","ns_st_ge":"Video,News,Top Video","cs_ucfr":""}}},"dfp":{"adTagUrl":"https://pubads.g.doubleclick.net/gampad/ads?sz=1x1000&iu=/5678/lin.wpri/health/coronavirus&impl=s&gdfp_req=1&env=vp&output=vmap&unviewed_position_start=1&vid=short_onecue&cmsid=1234&url=https://www.wpri.com/health/coronavirus/october-7-ri-coronavirus-update/&ciu_szs=728x90,300x250&ad_rule=1&description_url=https://www.wpri.com/health/coronavirus/october-7-ri-coronavirus-update/&cust_params=vid%3D5920070%26cmsid%3D615769%26pid%3D615769%26vidcat%3D/health/coronavirus%26bob_ck%3D[bob_ck_val]%26d_code%3Dna003"}},"accessKey":"m3E80nAx02K5gfOPJSgHJMr7nAk9MbDP","token":"eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJ2aWQiOiI1OTIwMDcwIiwiaXNzIjoibTNFODBuQXgwMks1Z2ZPUEpTZ0hKTXI3bkFrOU1iRFAiLCJleHAiOjE2MDI4MDA3NTJ9.NI0k2i8JZfBkij0bb4rATO0aoNzWGayQvWMXwBWTZhY","expectPrerollTimeout":8,"nxs":{"mp4Url":"https://nxsglobal.storage.googleapis.com/wpri/video/video_studio/102/20/10/08/5920070/5920070_CB41DD539BC04003A93C6C1212801A56_201008_5920070_Gov__Raimondo_puts_out_call_for_teaching_help_600.mp4"},"disableMutedAutoplay":false,"recommendations":false,"expectPreroll":true,"titleVisible":true,"pauseOnClick":true,"trackTimePeriod":60}</script></figure>\n\n\n<p>On the jobs front, Raimondo pointed to the fact that software company Infosys has 150 open positions in Providence they&#8217;re looking to fill immediately and encouraged people to apply.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>For anyone interested in those jobs that doesn&#8217;t have a tech degree, the company is offering job-specific recruitment and training through its&nbsp;<a rel="noreferrer noopener" href="https://www.infosys.com/reskillrestart-america.html" target="_blank">Reskill and Restart</a>&nbsp;program, which was launched in an effort to help people affected by the pandemic.</p>\n\n\n\n<aside class="promo-link">\n\t<a\n\t\thref="https://www.wpri.com/business-news/infosys-to-bring-500-more-tech-jobs-to-ri-by-2023/"\n\t\tclass="promo-link__link"\n\t>\n\t\tInfosys to bring 500 new tech jobs to RI by 2023<br>\t</a>\n</aside>\n\n\n\n<p>Additionally, Raimondo spoke briefly about the COVID-19 vaccine being worked on locally and around the world. She said with all of the uncertainty and misinformation going around, she intends to be completely transparent and let the public what she knows, when she knows it, and asserted the state will not release a vaccine until it is safe to do so.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Raimondo said the state will devote tens of millions of dollars in CARES Act and FEMA funding to distributing the vaccine, as well as convene a special subcommittee to oversee that process.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We want to make sure, in Rhode Island, everybody has access to the vaccine,&#8221; she said. &#8220;Regardless of where you live, rich or poor, immigration status, your neighborhood, whether or not you have insurance \xe2\x80\x93 we want to take care of you.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n<figure class="ns-block-embed-anvato"><div class="ns-block-embed__wrapper"><div id="p29"></div></div><script data-anvato-params article-list__article--is-stacked article-list__article--has-thumb article-list__article--has-excerpt"\n\t\t\tdata-article-id="625240"\n\t\t\tdata-index="0"\n\t\t\tdata-collection="article-list2"\n\t\t\tdata-anvato-params="null"\n\t\t>\n\t\t\t\n<div\n\tclass="article-list__article-text"\n\tdata-article-list-id="article-list2"\n\tdata-article-text-classes="article-list__article-text"\n\tdata-article-thumb-classes="article-list__article-thumb article-list__article-thumb--is-fullbleed-on-mobile"\n\tdata-current-image-context="[&quot;16:9&quot;,&quot;(max-width: 899px) 50vw, 876px&quot;]"\n>\n\t\t\t<h3 class="article-list__article-title">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t&#8216;She has insulted the entire city&#8217;: Pawtucket Teachers&#8217; Alliance demands apology from Raimondo\n\t\t\t\t\t</h3>\n\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<footer class="article-list__article-byline">\n\t\t\t\tby Sarah Doiron, Brandon Truitt <span class="sep">/</span> <time datetime="2020-10-15T17:25:39-04:00">Oct 15, 2020</time>\t\t\t</footer>\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t<div class="article-list__article-excerpt article-list__article-excerpt--is-faded rich-text">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t<p>PAWTUCKET, R.I. (WPRI) \xe2\x94\x80 The Pawtucket Teachers\' Alliance is calling upon Gov. Gina Raimondo to apologize for her remarks regarding the district\'s handling of the coronavirus pandemic, calling it a "reprehensible mischaracterization" of the city\'s school department.</p>\n<p>During her weekly coronavirus briefing on Wednesday, Raimondo expressed disappointment in the Pawtucket School Committee, which so far has had almost all of the city\xe2\x80\x99s students learning remotely.</p>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\n\t\t\t<div class="article-list__read-more article-list__read-more--w-arrow">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span>\n\t\t\t\t\tRead the Full Article\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class="icon icon--arrow">\n\t<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 17.938 10.94">\n\t\t<path d="M17.944 5.55a.733.733 0 0 1-.032.34v.03c0 .01-.006.01-.008.01a.189.189 0 0 1-.028.05.619.619 0 0 1-.123.17c-.009.01-.013.02-.023.03l-4.927 4.56a.733.733 0 0 1-.5.19.753.753 0 0 1-.54-.23.737.737 0 0 1 .041-1.04l3.547-3.28H.738a.735.735 0 1 1 0-1.47h14.693l-3.74-3.68a.735.735 0 0 1 1.03-1.05l5.022 4.94s0 .01.008.01a.016.016 0 0 0 .017.01.8.8 0 0 1 .163.32c.007.03.009.06.013.09z"/>\n\t</svg>\n</span>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\n\t</div>\n\n\n\t<figure class="article-list__article-thumb class="article-list__article-title">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\tCare New England says it unknowingly purchased counterfeit N95 masks\n\t\t\t\t\t</h3>\n\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<footer class="article-list__article-byline">\n\t\t\t\tby Sarah Doiron <span class="sep">/</span> <time datetime="2020-10-15T16:58:02-04:00">Oct 15, 2020</time>\t\t\t</footer>\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t<div class="article-list__article-excerpt article-list__article-excerpt--is-faded rich-text">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t<p>PROVIDENCE, R.I. (WPRI) \xe2\x94\x80 One of Rhode Island\'s top hospital groups is mitigating the accidental distribution of counterfeit N95 respirator masks to its employees.</p>\n<p>Care New England notified all staff members Thursday that at least one lot of Makrite N95 respirator masks they have in stock is counterfeit.</p>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\n\t\t\t<div class="article-list__read-more article-list__read-more--w-arrow">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span>\n\t\t\t\t\tRead the Full Article\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class="icon icon--arrow">\n\t<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 article-list__article--has-thumb article-list__article--has-excerpt"\n\t\t\tdata-article-id="624908"\n\t\t\tdata-index="2"\n\t\t\tdata-collection="article-list2"\n\t\t\tdata-anvato-params="null"\n\t\t>\n\t\t\t\n<div\n\tclass="article-list__article-text"\n\tdata-article-list-id="article-list2"\n\tdata-article-text-classes="article-list__article-text"\n\tdata-article-thumb-classes="article-list__article-thumb article-list__article-thumb--is-fullbleed-on-mobile"\n\tdata-current-image-context="[&quot;16:9&quot;,&quot;(max-width: 899px) 50vw, 876px&quot;]"\n>\n\t\t\t<h3 class="article-list__article-title">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t6 New Bedford restaurants cited for COVID-19 violations\n\t\t\t\t\t</h3>\n\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<footer class="article-list__article-byline">\n\t\t\t\tby Bay Gammans <span class="sep">/</span> <time datetime="2020-10-15T15:16:29-04:00">Oct 15, 2020</time>\t\t\t</footer>\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t<div class="article-list__article-excerpt article-list__article-excerpt--is-faded rich-text">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t<p>NEW BEDFORD, Mass. (WPRI) \xe2\x80\x94 The New Bedford Health Department has issued fines to six restaurants and bars for failure to comply with the city\'s COVID-19 regulations, city officials said Thursday.</p>\n<p>Mikey B\'s and Taqueria La Raza were both fined $100 for employees failing to wear masks, according to officials, and Casa Benefica was fined $100 for serving alcoholic beverages to customers without food.</p>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\n\t\t\t<div class="article-list__read-more article-list__read-more--w-arrow">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span>\n\t\t\t\t\tRead the Full 0-1.47h14.693l-3.74-3.68a.735.735 0 0 1 1.03-1.05l5.022 4.94s0 .01.008.01a.016.016 0 0 0 .017.01.8.8 0 0 1 .163.32c.007.03.009.06.013.09z"/>\n\t</svg>\n</span>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\n\t</div>\n\n\n\t<figure class="article-list__article-thumb class="article-list__article-title">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a\n\t\t\t\t\thref="https://www.wpri.com/news/local-news/blackstone-valley/she-has-insulted-the-entire-city-pawtucket-teachers-alliance-demands-apology-from-raimondo/"\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t>\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t&#8216;She class="article-list__article-thumb">\n\t\t\t\t\t<a\n\t\t\t\thref="https://www.wpri.com/news/local-news/blackstone-valley/she-has-insulted-the-entire-city-pawtucket-teachers-alliance-demands-apology-from-raimondo/"\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t>\n\t\t\n\t\t<div 512px"\n\t\tloading="lazy"\n\t/>\n</div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t</a>\n\t\t\t</figure>\n\t\t\t</article>\n\n\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\n</div>\n\n\t<div class="article-list__read-more article-list__read-more--w-arrow">\n\t\t<a href="https://www.wpri.com/weather/live-cams/">\n\t\t\tMore Live Cams\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class="icon icon--arrow">\n\t<svg id="ns-article-bin-36" class="widget widget_ns-article-bin">\t\t\t<section\n\t\t\t\tclass="article-list article-list-carousel class="article-list__content">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t<article\n\t\t\tclass="article-list__article article-list__article--is-stacked article-list__article--has-thumb class="article-list__heading article-list__heading--notched">\n\t\tThe Border Report Tour\t</h2>\n\n\n<div class="article-list__content">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t<article\n\t\t\tclass="article-list__article class="article-list__article-title">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<a\n\t\t\t\t\thref="https://www.wpri.com/border-report-tour/mexicos-president-met-with-signs-of-support-and-protest-in-juarez/"\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t>\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\tMexico&#8217;s president met with signs of support and protest in Juarez\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</a>\n\t\t\t\t\t</h3>\n\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<footer class="article-list__article-meta">\n\t\t\t\t<a
